title: Pitino to skip ACC basketball media day
text:

Hear his take on Rick Pitino and the atmosphere on college campuses. 3 of 10 VIDEOS | LOUISVILLE BASKETBALL KATINA POWELL SCANDAL Ex-Escort: I Was Paid $10K to Bring Girls for Sex with Basketball Recruits | 02:50 The famed University of Louisville basketball team is now caught up in an explosive sex scandal. Katina Powell, a former escort, is breaking her silence telling INSIDE EDITION. Matt Stone, The Courier-Journal 8 of 10 VIDEOS | LOUISVILLE BASKETBALL KATINA POWELL SCANDAL Video | Jeff Greer discusses the UofL book scandal | 08:28 The C-J's Jeff Greer and Chris White discuss the Katina Powell book, head coach Rick Pitino's reaction to it and what it means for basketball recruiting. Video by Jeff Faughender 9 of 10 VIDEOS | LOUISVILLE BASKETBALL KATINA POWELL SCANDAL Video | Pitino addresses media about recent allegations | 18:52 Louisville coach Rick Pitino says he was heartbroken when he heard the allegations that a former staff memeber purchased escorts for players/recruits. 10 of 10 Pitino talks escort allegations at Cards Luncheon Joel Klatt Isn't Buying That Rick Pitino Didn't Know About Sex Parties - 'The Herd' Jason Whitlock Doesn't See the Big Deal with the Louisville Sex Scandal Ex-Escort: I Was Paid $10K to Bring Girls for Sex with Basketball Recruits Video | Is Sex a Common Part of Recruiting Trips? - 'The Herd' Video | Louisville Sex Parties Were Run Like a Business - 'The Herd' Video | The Big Lead: What's Next at Louisville? Rick Pitino: 'The truth will come out' Video | Jeff Greer discusses the UofL book scandal Video | Pitino addresses media about recent allegations Puerto Rico head coach Rick Pitino reacts against the United States in the men's basketball preliminary round during the 2015 Pan Am Games at Ryerson Athletic Centre. (Photo: Geoff Burke-USA TODAY Sports) 51 CONNECT 46 TWEET LINKEDIN 11 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Louisville basketball coach Rick Pitino will skip ACC media day next week in Charlotte, the program announced Friday. Pitino, team spokesman Kenny Klein said, has been advised not to participate by the university's lawyers. 
Graduate transfers Trey Lewis and Damion Lee are still planning to attend Wednesday's event, which includes morning round-table interviews with print and Web writers, brief press conferences with television stations, radio interviews and short sit-down chats with the ACC's own digital network. 
"I do not want the allegations we are facing to negatively impact the other 14 institutions on what should be a great event to talk about the approaching basketball season," Pitino said in the release. "I realize that while many would like to question me on the allegations, the NCAA does not permit me to speak on the subject." 
The concept that Pitino may not attend the conference media day came up on Oct. 13 at the U of L Basketball Tipoff Luncheon.
